title.narrative: POVERTY AND SOCIAL EXCLUSION OF CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2022, selected consolidated municipalities including in conflict-affected regions have increased capacity to effectively respond to poverty and social exclusion of children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, evidence-driven, integrated and equitable social protection policies, efficient financial allocations and family-friendly local service provision are in place to address the social exclusion of children in Ukraine

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/881 EVIDENCE-DRIVEN, INTEGRATED AND EQUITABLE SOCIAL PROTECTION POLICIES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, selected consolidated municipalities including in conflict-affected regions have increased capacity to effectivelyrespond to poverty and social exclusion of children

description.narrative: More than 50 municipalities in Ukraine expanded their support to children in 2021 through UNICEF’s technical assistance and partnership. Despite the impact of COVID-19 and the imposed restrictions, municipalities managed to implement their plans for children. As a result, three municipalities were granted the child and youth friendly status.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
